member.name: T:Yeppp.CpuVendor
member.summary: The company which designed the processor microarchitecture.

member.name: F:Yeppp.CpuVendor.Unknown
member.summary: Processor vendor is not known to the library, or the library failed to get vendor information from the OS.

member.name: F:Yeppp.CpuVendor.Intel
member.summary: Intel Corporation. Vendor of x86, x86-64, IA64, and ARM processor microarchitectures.
member.remarks: Sold its ARM design subsidiary in 2006. The last ARM processor design was released in 2004.

member.name: F:Yeppp.CpuVendor.AMD
member.summary: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. Vendor of x86 and x86-64 processor microarchitectures.

member.name: F:Yeppp.CpuVendor.VIA
member.summary: VIA Technologies, Inc. Vendor of x86 and x86-64 processor microarchitectures.
member.remarks: Processors are designed by Centaur Technology, a subsidiary of VIA Technologies.

member.name: F:Yeppp.CpuVendor.Transmeta
member.summary: Transmeta Corporation. Vendor of x86 processor microarchitectures.
member.remarks: Now defunct. The last processor design was released in 2004.
Transmeta processors implemented VLIW ISA and used binary translation to execute x86 code.

member.name: F:Yeppp.CpuVendor.Cyrix
member.summary: Cyrix Corporation. Vendor of x86 processor microarchitectures.
member.remarks: Now defunct. The last processor design was released in 1996.

member.name: F:Yeppp.CpuVendor.Rise
member.summary: Rise Technology. Vendor of x86 processor microarchitectures.
member.remarks: Now defunct. The last processor design was released in 1999.

member.name: F:Yeppp.CpuVendor.NSC
member.summary: National Semiconductor. Vendor of x86 processor microarchitectures.
member.remarks: Sold its x86 design subsidiary in 1999. The last processor design was released in 1998.

member.name: F:Yeppp.CpuVendor.SiS
member.summary: Silicon Integrated Systems. Vendor of x86 processor microarchitectures.
member.remarks: Sold its x86 design subsidiary in 2001. The last processor design was released in 2001.

member.name: F:Yeppp.CpuVendor.NexGen
member.summary: NexGen. Vendor of x86 processor microarchitectures.
member.remarks: Now defunct. The last processor design was released in 1994.
NexGen designed the first x86 microarchitecture which decomposed x86 instructions into simple microoperations.

member.name: F:Yeppp.CpuVendor.UMC
member.summary: United Microelectronics Corporation. Vendor of x86 processor microarchitectures.
member.remarks: Ceased x86 in the early 1990s. The last processor design was released in 1991.
Designed U5C and U5D processors. Both are 486 level.

member.remarks: Designes embedded x86 CPUs.

member.name: T:Yeppp.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Yeppp! library functions.

member.name: T:Yeppp.Library
member.summary: Non-computational functions for checking library version, quering information about processor, and benchmarking.

member.name: M:Yeppp.Library.Release
member.summary: Deinitializes Yeppp! library and releases all associated resources.
member.remarks: This function is inteded for .Net libraries which might be unloaded (e.g. plugins) and should be called immediately before the module is unloaded.
Calling Yeppp! functions after after a call to this method is prohibited and might crash the application.
member.exception: Resources allocated by Yeppp! library could not be unloaded due to memory corruption.
Yeppp! library is already released by this module.

member.name: M:Yeppp.Library.GetVersion
member.summary: Provides information about Yeppp! library version.
member.returns: An object describing Yeppp! library version.

member.name: M:Yeppp.Library.IsSupported(Yeppp.CpuIsaFeature)
member.summary: Checks if the specified ISA extension is supported by the processor.
member.param: An object specifying the ISA extension of interest.
member.returns: true if processor supports the specified ISA extension and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Yeppp.Library.IsSupported(Yeppp.CpuSimdFeature)
member.summary: Checks if the specified SIMD extension is supported by the processor.
member.param: An object specifying the SIMD extension of interest.
member.returns: true if processor supports the specified SIMD extension and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Yeppp.Library.IsSupported(Yeppp.CpuSystemFeature)
member.summary: Checks if the specified non-ISA CPU or system extension is supported by the processor.
member.param: An object specifying the non-ISA CPU or system extension of interest.
member.returns: true if processor supports the specified non-ISA CPU or system extension and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Yeppp.Library.GetProcessABI
member.summary: Provides information about the ABI of the running process.
member.returns: An ABI object with information about the application binary interface (ABI) of the running process.

member.name: M:Yeppp.Library.GetCpuVendor
member.summary: Provides information about the vendor of the processor.
member.returns: A CpuVendor object with information about the company which designed the CPU core.

member.name: M:Yeppp.Library.GetCpuArchitecture
member.summary: Provides information about the architecture of the processor.
member.returns: A CpuArchitecture instance with information about the architecture of the CPU.

member.name: M:Yeppp.Library.GetCpuMicroarchitecture
member.summary: Provides information about the microarchitecture of the processor.
member.returns: A CpuMicroarchitecture instance with information about the microarchitecture of the CPU core.

member.name: M:Yeppp.Library.AcquireCycleCounter
member.summary: Initializes the processor cycle counter and starts counting the processor cycles.
member.remarks: Call to get the number of processor cycles passed.

The cycle counters are not guaranteed to be syncronized across different processors/cores in a multiprocessor/multicore system. It is recommended to bind the current thread to a particular logical processor before using this function.
member.returns: An object representing the state of the processor cycle counter. Pass this object to to get the number of cycles passed.
member.exception: The processor does not have a cycle counter or the operating system does not provide access to the CPU cycle counter
If the attempt to read the cycle counter or release the OS resources failed inside the OS kernel.

member.name: M:Yeppp.Library.ReleaseCycleCounter(Yeppp.CpuCycleCounterState)
member.summary: Stops counting the processor cycles, releases the system resources associated with the cycle counter, and returns the number of cycles elapsed.
member.param: An object representing the state of the cycle counter returned by . The cycle counter should be released only once, and this function invalidates the state object.
member.returns: The number of cycles elapsed since the call to .
member.exception: The cycleCounter object is not a valid state of the cycle counter. This can happen if the cycleCounter object was released previously.
The processor does not have a cycle counter or the operating system does not provide access to the CPU cycle counter
If the attempt to read the cycle counter or release the OS resources failed inside the OS kernel.

member.name: M:Yeppp.Library.GetTimerTicks
member.summary: Queries the ticks count of the high-resolution system timer.
member.remarks: The difference in ticks between two time moments divided by timer frequency gives the number of seconds between two time moments.
member.returns: The current ticks count of the high-resolution system timer.
member.exception: The attempt to read the high-resolution timer failed inside the OS kernel.

member.name: M:Yeppp.Library.GetTimerFrequency
member.summary: Queries the frequency (number of ticks per second) of the high-resolution system timer.
member.remarks: The difference in ticks between two time moments divided by timer frequency gives the number of seconds between two time moments.
member.returns: The frequency of the high-resolution system timer.
member.exception: The attempt to read the high-resolution timer frequency failed inside the OS kernel.

member.name: M:Yeppp.Library.GetTimerAccuracy
member.summary: Detects the minimum time difference in nanoseconds which can be measured by the high-resolution system timer.
member.returns: The accuracy (in nanoseconds) of the high-resolution system timer.
member.exception: If the attempt to measure the accuracy of high-resolution timer failed inside the OS kernel.

member.name: T:Yeppp.Version
member.summary: Contains information about @Yeppp library version.

member.name: M:Yeppp.Version.ToString
member.summary: Provides a string representation for all parts of the version.
member.returns: The full version string in the format "major.minor.patch.build (release name)".

member.name: P:Yeppp.Version.Major
member.summary: The major version number of Yeppp! library.
member.remarks: Library releases with the same major versions are guaranteed to be API- and ABI-compatible.

member.name: P:Yeppp.Version.Minor
member.summary: The minor version number of Yeppp! library.
member.remarks: A change in minor versions indicates addition of new features, and major bug-fixes.

member.name: P:Yeppp.Version.Patch
member.summary: The patch level of Yeppp! library.
member.remarks: A version with a higher patch level indicates minor bug-fixes.

member.name: P:Yeppp.Version.Build
member.summary: The build number of Yeppp! library.
member.remarks: The build number is unique for the fixed combination of major, minor, and patch-level versions.

member.name: P:Yeppp.Version.ReleaseName
member.summary: Human-readable name of this release of Yeppp! library
member.remarks: The release name may contain non-ASCII characters.

member.param: Input array.
Offset of the first element in xArray.
Output array.
Offset of the first element in yArray.
The length of the slices of xArray and yArray to use in computation.
member.exception: If xArray or yArray is null.
If xArray or yArray is not naturally aligned.
If length is negative.
If xOffset is negative, xOffset + length exceeds the length of xArray, yOffset is negative, yOffset + length exceeds the length of yArray, or length is negative.

member.name: M:Yeppp.Math.Tan_V64f_V64f(System.Double*,System.Double*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes tangent on an array of double precision (64-bit) floating-point elements.
member.param: Pointer to the array of elements on which tangent will be computed.
Pointer the array where the computed tangents will be stored.
Length of the arrays specified by x and y.
member.exception: If x or y is null.
If x or y is not naturally aligned.
If length is negative.
